heading: Hydroxyapatite in Dentistry
para: Hydroxyapatite, a naturally occurring mineral in tooth enamel, is emerging as a promising alternative to fluoride in modern dentistry. In its nano form, it has shown great potential in reducing dentine hypersensitivity and aiding in enamel remineralization by filling microscopic cracks and restoring lost minerals. Research suggests that hydroxyapatite-based treatments can effectively strengthen teeth and prevent cavities, making them an attractive option for those seeking fluoride-free solutions. While its benefits are gaining recognition, its widespread adoption in mainstream dental practice is still under evaluation. As studies continue to highlight its effectiveness, hydroxyapatite may soon become a key player in preventive oral care.
